010package imagingbook.common.edges;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015import java.util.List;
016import java.util.Stack;
017
018import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
019import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
020import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
021import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
022import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianKernel1D;
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
024import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.DialogDigits;
025import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.DialogLabel;
026import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
027import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
028import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
029
030
031/**
032 * <p>
033 * This class implements a Canny edge detector for grayscale and RGB images.
034 * See Sec. 16.3 (Alg. 16.3) of [1] for more detail.
035 * The edge detector is "lazy" in the sense that it performs local non-
036 * maximum suppression and edge tracing only when the results are explicitly 
037 * queried (by the methods {@link #getEdgeBinary()} and {@link #getEdgeTraces()}).
038 * </p>
039 * <p>
040 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 
041 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
042 * </p>
043 * 
044 * @author WB
045 * @version 2021/11/26
046 * @version 2022/03/22 added parameter annotations for dialogs
047 * @version 2022/09/04 converted to implement interface, use {@link PixelPack}
048 */
049public class CannyEdgeDetector implements EdgeDetector {
050        
051        // TODO: implement convolutions with GenericFilter
052        
053        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle<CannyEdgeDetector> {
054                
055                /** Gaussian sigma (scale, default = 2) */
056                @DialogLabel("Gaussian sigma (scale)")@DialogDigits(1)
057                public double gSigma = 2.0f;
058                
059                /** High threshold (defaults to 20% of maximum edge magnitude) */
060                @DialogLabel("High threshold (% of max. edge magnitude)")@DialogDigits(1)
061                public double hiThr  = 20.0f;
062                
063                /** Low threshold (defaults to 5% of maximum edge magnitude) */
064                @DialogLabel("Low threshold (% of max. edge magnitude)")@DialogDigits(1)
065                public double loThr = 5.0f;
066                
067                /** Set {@code true} to normalize gradient magnitude */
068                @DialogLabel("normalize gradient magnitude")
069                public boolean normGradMag = true;
070                
071                @Override
072                public boolean validate () { 
073                        return gSigma >= 0.1f && loThr < hiThr;
074                }
075        }
076        
077        private static final float CosPi8 = (float) Math.cos(Math.PI/8);
078        private static final float SinPi8 = (float) Math.sin(Math.PI/8);
079        
080        private final Parameters params;
081        private final int M, N;                                                 // width and height of I
082        
083        private FloatProcessor Emag = null;                             // gradient magnitude
084        private FloatProcessor Enms = null;                             // non-max suppressed gradient magnitude
085        private FloatProcessor Ex = null, Ey = null;    // edge normal vectors
086        private ByteProcessor  Ebin = null;                             // final (binary) edge map
087        private List<EdgeTrace> edgeTraces = null;              // list of edge traces
088        
089        
090        /**
091         * Constructor using default parameters.
092         * @param ip the image to be processed
093         */
094        public CannyEdgeDetector(ImageProcessor ip) {
095                this(ip, new Parameters());
096        }
097        
098        /**
099         * Constructor using specific parameters.
100         * @param ip the image to be processed
101         * @param params a {@link CannyEdgeDetector.Parameters} object
102         */
103        public CannyEdgeDetector(ImageProcessor ip, Parameters params) {
104                if (!params.validate()) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
105                this.params = params;
106                M = ip.getWidth();
107                N = ip.getHeight();
108                makeGradientsAndMagnitude(ip);
109        }
110
111        //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
112        
113        // do the inital work only
114        private void makeGradientsAndMagnitude(ImageProcessor I) {
115                if (I instanceof ColorProcessor) 
116                        makeGradientsAndMagnitudeColor((ColorProcessor) I);
117                else
118                        makeGradientsAndMagnitudeGray(I);
119                // this is done "on demand":
120                //nonMaxSuppression();
121                //detectAndTraceEdges();
122        }
123
124        private void makeGradientsAndMagnitudeGray(ImageProcessor ip) {         
125                FloatProcessor fp = ip.convertToFloatProcessor();       // always makes a copy
126                // pre-smooth the image with a separable Gaussian filter
127                float[] gaussKernel = GaussianKernel1D.makeGaussKernel1D(params.gSigma, true);
128                IjUtils.convolveX(fp, gaussKernel);
129                IjUtils.convolveY(fp, gaussKernel);
130                
131                // calculate the gradients in X- and Y-direction
132                Ex = fp;
133                Ey = (FloatProcessor) fp.duplicate();
134                
135                float[] gradKernel = {-0.5f, 0, 0.5f};
136                IjUtils.convolveX(Ex, gradKernel);
137                IjUtils.convolveY(Ey, gradKernel);
138                
139                Emag = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
140                float emax = 0;
141                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
142                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
143                                double dx = Ex.getf(u,v);
144                                double dy = Ey.getf(u,v);
145                                float mag = (float) Math.hypot(dx, dy);
146                                if (mag > emax) 
147                                        emax = mag;
148                                Emag.setf(u, v, mag);
149                        }
150                }
151                
152                // normalize gradient magnitude (to max. value 100):
153                if (params.normGradMag && emax > 0.001f) {
154                        Emag.multiply(100.0/emax);
155                }
156        }
157        
158        private void makeGradientsAndMagnitudeColor(ColorProcessor cp) {
159                FloatProcessor[] I = new PixelPack(cp).getFloatProcessors();    
160                // pre-smooth the image with a separable Gaussian filter (on each RGB channel):
161                float[] gaussKernel = GaussianKernel1D.makeGaussKernel1D(params.gSigma, true);
162                for (int k = 0; k < I.length; k++) {
163                        IjUtils.convolveX(I[k], gaussKernel);
164                        IjUtils.convolveY(I[k], gaussKernel);
165                }
166                
167                // calculate the gradients in X- and Y-direction for each RGB channel:
168                FloatProcessor[] Ix = new FloatProcessor[3];
169                FloatProcessor[] Iy = new FloatProcessor[3];
170                float[] gradKernel = {-0.5f, 0, 0.5f};
171                for (int k = 0; k < I.length; k++) {
172                        Ix[k] = I[k];
173                        Iy[k] = (FloatProcessor) I[k].duplicate();
174                        IjUtils.convolveX(Ix[k], gradKernel);
175                        IjUtils.convolveY(Iy[k], gradKernel);
176                }
177
178                // calculate color gradient magnitude:
179                Ex = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
180                Ey = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
181                Emag = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
182                
183                float emax = 0;
184                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
185                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
186                                double rx = Ix[0].getf(u,v), ry = Iy[0].getf(u,v);
187                                double gx = Ix[1].getf(u,v), gy = Iy[1].getf(u,v);
188                                double bx = Ix[2].getf(u,v), by = Iy[2].getf(u,v);
189                                double A = rx*rx + gx*gx + bx*bx;
190                                double B = ry*ry + gy*gy + by*by;
191                                double C = rx*ry + gx*gy + bx*by;
192                                
193//                              Eigensolver2x2 es = new Eigensolver2x2(A, C, C, B);
194//                              if (!es.isReal()) {
195//                                      throw new ArithmeticException(
196//                                                      String.format("No real eigenvalues for structure matrix at position (%d, %d)", u, v));
197//                              }
198//                              float mag = (float) Math.sqrt(es.getEigenvalue(0));
199//                              double[] eVec0 = es.getEigenvector(0);
200//                              Emag.setf(u, v, mag);
201//                              Ex.setf(u, v, (float) eVec0[0]);
202//                              Ey.setf(u, v, (float) eVec0[1]);
203                                
204                                double D = (float) Math.sqrt(sqr(A - B) + 4 * sqr(C));  
205                                double lambda0 = (A + B + D) / 2;                                               // eigenvalue lambda_0
206                                Emag.setf(u, v, (float) Math.sqrt(lambda0));
207                                Ex.setf(u, v, (float) (A - B + D));                                             // eigenvector x_0
208                                Ey.setf(u, v, (float) (2 * C));                                                 // eigenvector y_0
209                        }
210                }
211                // normalize gradient magnitude 
212                if (params.normGradMag && emax > 0.001) 
213                        Emag.multiply(100.0/emax);
214        }
215        
216        //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
217        
218        // perform non-maximum suppression along gradient direction
219        private void nonMaxSuppression() {
220                Enms = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
221                for (int v = 1; v < N - 1; v++) {
222                        for (int u = 1; u < M - 1; u++) {
223                                int s_theta = getOrientationSector(Ex.getf(u, v), Ey.getf(u, v));
224                                if (isLocalMaximum(Emag, u, v, s_theta, (float) params.loThr)) {
225                                        Enms.setf(u, v, Emag.getf(u, v)); // keep local maximum only
226                                }
227                        }
228                }
229        }
230        
231        private void detectAndTraceEdges() {
232                if (Enms == null) {
233                        nonMaxSuppression();
234                }
235                Ebin = new ByteProcessor(M, N);
236                int color = 255;
237                edgeTraces = new ArrayList<>();
238                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
239                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
240                                if (Enms.getf(u, v) >= params.hiThr && Ebin.get(u, v) == 0) { // unmarked edge point
241                                        List<PntInt> pnts = traceAndThreshold(u, v, (float) params.loThr, color);
242                                        if (!pnts.isEmpty()) {
243                                                edgeTraces.add(new EdgeTrace(pnts));
244                                        }
245                                }
246                        }
247                }
248        }
249        
250        // Determines if the gradient magnitude is a local maximum at position (u,v)
251        // in direction s_theta.
252        private boolean isLocalMaximum(FloatProcessor gradMagnitude, int u, int v, int s_theta, float mMin) {
253                float mC = gradMagnitude.getf(u, v);
254                if (mC < mMin) {
255                        return false;
256                }
257                else {
258                        float mL = 0, mR = 0;
259                        switch (s_theta) {
260                        case 0 : 
261                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u-1, v);
262                                mR = gradMagnitude.getf(u+1, v);
263                                break;
264                        case 1 : 
265                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u-1, v-1);
266                                mR = gradMagnitude.getPixelValue(u+1, v+1);
267                                break;
268                        case 2 : 
269                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u, v-1);
270                                mR = gradMagnitude.getf(u, v+1);
271                                break;
272                        case 3 : 
273                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u-1, v+1);
274                                mR = gradMagnitude.getf(u+1, v-1);
275                                break;
276                        }
277                        return (mL <= mC && mC >= mR);
278                }
279        }
280        
281        /**
282         * Recursively collect and mark all pixels of an edge that are 8-connected to 
283         * (u0,v0) and have a gradient magnitude above loThr.
284         * @param u0 start coordinate (x)
285         * @param v0 start coordinate (y)
286         * @param loThr low threshold (min. edge magnitude to continue tracing)
287         * @param markVal value used for marking pixels on an edge trace
288         * @return a list of Point objects.
289         */
290        private List<PntInt> traceAndThreshold(int u0, int v0, float loThr, int markVal) {
291                //IJ.log("  working point " + u + " " + v);
292                Stack<PntInt> pointStack = new Stack<>();
293//              EdgeTrace trace = new EdgeTrace();
294                List<PntInt> trace = new ArrayList<>();
295                pointStack.push(PntInt.from(u0, v0));
296                while (!pointStack.isEmpty()) {
297                        PntInt p = pointStack.pop();
298                        int up = p.x;
299                        int vp = p.y;
300                        Ebin.putPixel(up, vp, markVal); // mark this edge point
301                        trace.add(p);
302                                
303                        int uL = Math.max(up - 1, 0);           // (up > 0) ? up-1 : 0;
304                        int uR = Math.min(up + 1, M - 1);       // (up < M-1) ? up+1 : M-1;
305                        int vT = Math.max(vp - 1, 0);           // (vp > 0) ? vp - 1 : 0;
306                        int vB = Math.min(vp + 1, N - 1);       // (vp < N-1) ? vp+1 : N-1;
307                        
308                        for (int u = uL; u <= uR; u++) {
309                                for (int v = vT; v <= vB; v++) {
310                                        if (Ebin.get(u, v) == 0 && Enms.getf(u, v) >= loThr) { 
311                                                pointStack.push(PntInt.from(u,v));
312                                        }
313                                }
314                        }
315                }
316                return trace;
317        }
318        
319        // returns the quantized orientation sector for vector (dx, dy)
320        private int getOrientationSector(float dx, float dy) {
321                // rotate the gradient vector by PI/8
322                float dxR = CosPi8 * dx - SinPi8 * dy;
323                float dyR = SinPi8 * dx + CosPi8 * dy;  
324                // mirror vector (dxR,dyR) to [0,PI]
325                if (dyR < 0) {
326                        dxR = -dxR;
327                        dyR = -dyR;
328                }
329                // determine the octant for (dx, dy)
330                int s_theta;
331                if (dxR >= 0) { // dxR >= 0, dyR >= 0
332                        if (dxR >= dyR)
333                                s_theta = 0; // return 0;
334                        else
335                                s_theta = 1; // return 1;
336                }
337                else {  // dxR < 0, dyR >= 0
338                        if (-dxR < dyR)
339                                s_theta = 2; // return 2;
340                        else
341                                s_theta = 3; //return 3;
342                }
343                return s_theta;
344        }
345        
346        @Override
347        public FloatProcessor getEdgeMagnitude() {
348                return Emag;
349        }
350
351        @Override
352        public FloatProcessor getEdgeOrientation() {
353                FloatProcessor E_theta = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
354                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
355                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
356                                double ex = Ex.getf(u, v);
357                                double ey = Ey.getf(u, v);
358                                float theta = (float) Math.atan2(ey, ex);
359                                E_theta.setf(u, v, theta);
360                        }
361                }
362                return E_theta;
363        }
364        
365        /**
366         * Returns a binary edge image, obtained by rendering the
367         * detected edge traces.
368         * See also {@link #getEdgeTraces()}
369         * @return a binary image ({@link ByteProcessor})
370         */
371        public ByteProcessor getEdgeBinary() {
372                if (Ebin == null) {
373                        detectAndTraceEdges();
374                }
375                return Ebin;
376        }
377        
378        /**
379         * Returns a list of detected {@link EdgeTrace} instances.
380         * @return a list of {@link EdgeTrace} instances
381         */
382        public List<EdgeTrace> getEdgeTraces() {
383                if (edgeTraces == null) {
384                        detectAndTraceEdges();
385                }
386                return edgeTraces;
387        }
388
389}
